snippet: In a highly unusual move, the agency has decided to reopen the case on Avandia and will ask a committee whether it should reconsider the restrictions on the drug.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration decides to reopen case on diabetes drug Avandia and ask panel of experts whether it must reconsider restrictions on drug; Avandia was all but banned from use three years ago after researchers found thousands of people had heart problems after taking it; lifting limits would amount to major policy reversal and huge victory for GlaxoSmithKline.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and SABRINA TAVERNISE

lead_paragraph: In a highly unusual move, the agency has decided to reopen the case on Avandia and will ask a committee whether it should reconsider the restrictions on the drug.

headline.seo: Second Thoughts on Safety of Avandia Stir a Dispute
headline.main: F.D.A. to Reconsider Restrictions on Diabetes Drug
headline.print_headline: A Dispute Over Safety Of a Drug For Diabetes
